result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcell D Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.  Obtain GED or HSED.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with any gangs or gang members. No contact with MC. Must establish paternity for child born to ML. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Firearm warning given.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Marcell D Adams in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Marcell D Adams in custody.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
Matter here for sentencing.
State has recieved PSI and has no additional information or corrections. 
Defense has recieved PSI and states updated information on the record. 

Parties give arguments on requests for sentencing. Defendant gives statement. 

BTC:  8 years WSP bifurcated 4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision consecutive to any other case. 

CONDITIONS: 
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician,to be monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts.  AODA & follow through.  
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent & follow through with recommendations.
Obtain HSED/GED.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment or employment / school to equal full time.
Establish paternity for child that was just born to M.L.
COMPLY WITH CHILD SUPPORT ORDERS.
No contact with:  M.C
No contact with:  ANY GANGS/ GANG MEMBERS
FAW / vote / jury service
Bad Time Rules to be attached to JOC.
CIP:  yes
ERP:  yes
CC+ DNA Surcharge/sample

Credit for time served if applicable in this case.

Status conference on July 12, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random UAs and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program. You must report to room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403) by 4:00 pm on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm). In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with Law Enforcement.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
